page.title: 19Interview with Policeman.
page.content: to Banchory in 1976. At the moment there are eight constables, one sergeant and a typist at the Banchory Police Station. Although there are no fixed times there is generally a policeman at the station from between 8 o'clock and 9 o'clock in the morning until sometimes 4 o'clock the next morning. There are no actual patrol cars in Banchory. They are based in Stonehaven and visit the area from time to time. Banchory does have one general purpose vehicle. Banchory is a fairly crime free town, the most common offences being traffic offences. In the tourist season, however, the crime rate does increase. This is due to travelling criminals and it is difficult to tell the difference between them and the tourists. The number of road accidents also increases in the
